attributes.description:
Canned light meat tuna is made from Skipjack and Yellowtail tuna. We will be following a catch of these tuna from commercial fishing grounds to the Oregon market.

To understand Chicken of the Sea's commodity chain, we must first examine its supply partners. Chicken of the Sea is partnered with Tri-Union Seafoods LLC which is comprised of three companies: Thai Union International Inc., Caribbean Marine Service, Co., and Tri-Marine International, Inc. Each of these partners play a role in the supply and distribution of Chicken of the Sea tuna. However, for simplicity's sake, we will be focusing mainly on Tri-Marine International and their contribution to the supply chain which includes the fishing of tuna, the transport to processing plants, and the canning of that tuna. At processing plants, the tuna receives the Chicken of the Sea brand name and is transported to market by Chicken of the Sea. Though Tri-Marine International accounts for the majority of this map, we have included a few other example of commodity chains that we know exist with Chicken of the Sea canned light tuna.
attributes.title: Chicken of the Sea: Light Meat Tuna

attributes.address: San Pedro, Los Angeles, CA, USA
attributes.title: Processing Plant
Commercial Fishing to Processing Plant
attributes.description: Fishing vessels meet with carrier ships where tuna is transferred and frozen for transport. Carrier ships then carry tuna to processing plants.

attributes.title: Commercial Fishing to Processing Plant
attributes.description: Fishing vessels meet with carrier ships where tuna is transferred and frozen for transport. Carrier ships then carry tuna to processing plants.

attributes.title: Commercial Fishing to Tuna Fishing Port
attributes.description: Fishing vessels meet with carrier ships where tuna is transferred and frozen for transport. Carrier ships then carry tuna to processing plants.
Unprocessed tuna is transported by truck to the cannery where it becomes a finished product.
attributes.title: Tuna Fishing Port to Processing Plant
Processing Plant to Retail Distribution
attributes.description: Canned tuna is transported via truck to Chicken of the Sea's retail distribution center in Fremont, CA.
The Chicken of the Sea finished product is packaged and is finally shipped to its designated market, in our case, Salem, OR.
attributes.title: Retail Distribution to Canned Tuna on Market

attributes.description: Canned tuna is transported via truck to Chicken of the Sea's retail distribution center in Fremont, CA.
attributes.title: Processing Plant to Retail Distribution

attributes.description: Canned tuna is transported via truck to Chicken of the Sea's retail distribution center in Fremont, CA.
attributes.title: Processing Plant to Retail Distribution

attributes.description: Fishing vessels meet with carrier ships where tuna is transferred and frozen for transport. Carrier ships then carry tuna to processing plants.
attributes.title: Commercial Fishing to Tuna Fishing Port

attributes.description: Fishing vessels meet with carrier ships where tuna is transferred and frozen for transport. Carrier ships then carry tuna to processing plants.
attributes.title: Commercial Fishing to Processing Plant
Processing Plant to Market
attributes.description: Processed tuna is shipped to an East Asian market, for example Hong Kong.
Canned tuna is transported to a Global Trade Center where the product can be shipped to more distant markets as opposed to a more local commodity chain.
attributes.title: Processing Plant to Global Trade Center
Global Trade Center to Market
attributes.description: Packaged tuna is shipped/flown worldwide, potentially ending up in Oregon.
